item.title: india beats pakistan to storm into cricket final
item.description: india kept alive a billion dreams after sinking pakistan in their world cup semi-final on wednesday to set up an all-asian final against sri lanka.

item.description: the knicks announced that they are bringing back point guard chauncey billups for next season.

item.title: even the optometrist asks, 'where are you going to college?'
item.description: "forget about basketball brackets,'' writes michael campbell, a high school senior from denver, "this waiting is the real march madness.''

item.title: china sees strong commodities, weak dollar in 2011
item.description: loose monetary policies in developed economies will place more upward pressure on global commodity prices and weigh on the dollar this year, the chinese central bank said on...

item.title: ivory coast will seize unexported cocoa
item.description: ivory coast's cocoa board is ordering exporters to resume business or have their remaining stocks seized at the end of the month.

item.title: u.s. automakers poised to capitalize on japanese shortages
item.description: fresh lineups of fuel-efficient cars and crossovers from u.s. automakers could lure customers once loyal to japanese brands.

item.description: r. a. dickey partly tore the plantar fascia on his right foot but hopes to avoid the disabled list.

item.title: earth day organizers call for "a billion acts of green"
item.description: if the environmental movement has a high holiday, earth day is it.

item.title: cboe chief's pay dwarfs rivals at nyse, cme
item.description: cboe holdings inc chief executive officer william brodsky, who steered the operator of the biggest u.s. options market through an initial public offering last june, received a giant pay boost for his efforts.

item.title: utah church offers free korans in easter gesture
item.description: a utah church is giving away free copies of the koran in an easter season ecumenical riposte to the recent burning of the islamic holy book by a controversial florida pastor.

item.title: india, pakistan fail to make progress on glacier talks
item.description: india and pakistan failed on tuesday to break ice on how to demilitarize the world's highest battlefield in the himalayan region in a sign of how far apart the nuclear-armed rivals are even on less contentious issues.

item.description: pro teams are increasingly promoting christian, jewish and mormon fan days, because they help drive group ticket sales in a recession. pro teams ...

item.title: chinese warship may be nearly ready
item.description: photos posted online by the state news agency carried captions that said the warship was expected to sail later this year.

item.title: caps and pens win in double overtime as wings advance
item.description: the washington capitals silenced a stunned new york crowd by rallying from three goals down to beat the rangers in double overtime and seize control of their nhl playoffs series on wednesday.

item.title: chicago crushes vancouver, boston pulls even
item.description: the defending stanley cup champion chicago blackhawks crushed the vancouver canucks 5-0 on thursday, continuing a nail-biting nhl playoff comeback.

item.title: kings squander lead as sharks rally; hawks still alive
item.description: the los angeles kings blew a four-goal lead and lost 6-5 in overtime to the san jose sharks in the first round of the nhl playoffs on tuesday, while chicago routed vancouver 7-2 to keep their series alive.

item.title: sports briefing | winter sports: cuche captures super-g
item.description: a day after he was fined $5,400 by the international ski federation for threatening a referee because of a jump he called unsafe, didier cuche of switzerland held off two austrians to win a world cup super-g.

item.title: with supplies dwindling, some honda dealers foresee long, dry summer
item.description: north american deliveries of the brand's most fuel-efficient models are delayed until september, and potentially beyond.

item.title: lightning flash their scoring touch to rout penguins
item.description: steven stamkos, simon gagne and pavel kubina each scored a pair of goals to power the tampa bay lightning to an 8-2 rout of the pittsburgh penguins on saturday and keep alive their first round playoff series.

item.title: capitals clinch series, tampa thump penguins
item.description: led by alex ovechkin, the washington capitals dumped the new york rangers 3-1 on saturday to advance to the second round of the stanley cup playoffs and bury memories of last year's post-season collapse.

item.title: ugandan police fire teargas at besigye supporters
item.description: ugandan police fired teargas to disperse thousands of supporters of opposition leader kizza besigye at the same time as president yoweri museveni was being sworn in for a fourth term, reuters witnesses said.

item.title: jihadis voice grief and determination at death of their inspiration
item.description: in internet forums, gatherings, and interviews, al qaeda and its affiliates vowed continue their struggle against the west and its allies following the death of osama bin laden.

item.title: tornado kills one, destroys school in oklahoma town
item.description: a tornado killed at least one person and destroyed the only school in the small southeastern oklahoma town of tushka on thursday evening, authorities said.

item.description: this week's podcast includes a discussion about the eniac programmers project, cloud storage and slacker radio.

item.title: "glee" producer adam anders launches record label

item.title: georgian police: 1 officer killed in protest
item.description: a policeman died after being struck by a car containing protest organizers that was speeding from the site of a clash.

item.title: cancer costs highest for individually insured
item.description: one of every seven cancer patients spends more than 20 percent of his income on health care and insurance, according to a new study from federal researchers.

item.title: "mad men" air date pushed back to early 2012
item.description: the ad agency drama "mad men," which was due to begin its fifth season in the summer, will not return until early 2012 because of stalled contract talks with its creator, cable channel amc said on tuesday.

item.title: open text poised to grow due to solid pipeline: analysts
item.description: canada's largest software company open text corp has strong prospects for growth partly due to its solid pipeline, analysts said, and raised their price target on the stock, a day after it posted a jump in quarterly profit.

item.title: egypt's military issues interim constitution
item.description: egypt's military rulers on wednesday issued an interim constitution under which the transitional administration will run the country until elections allow power to be returned to an elected government.

item.description: want to fire someone? be careful: employment laws are constantly changing and being updated.

item.description: rafael nadal of spain used his potent forehand and a strong-arm backhand service return to move easily into the fourth round of the french open saturday. he defeated antonio veic of croatia, the world's 227th ranked player, 6-1, 6-3, 6-0.

item.title: at war: 'we' got him
item.description: watching young people celebrating the death of osama bin laden with chants of "we got him!" outside the white house and ground zero, i was struck by a paradox. for nearly a decade of war, it hasn't felt much like "we."

item.description: nebraska lawmakers unanimously approved changes to collective bargaining for public workers on wednesday but the debate was not as divisive as in some other states, and the outcome was a compromise.
